plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are classic garden plants known for their fragrant, often multi-petaled blooms. Many varieties are in full flower during early summer, showcasing a wide range of colors from white to deep red.
plants.funFact: Roses have been cultivated for over 5,000 years and are symbols of love and beauty worldwide.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: This wildflower features tall spikes of densely packed pea-like flowers. It thrives in cooler climates and blooms profusely in late spring and early summer.
plants.location: Native to western North America, commonly found in meadows and along roadsides in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich the soil by fixing nitrogen, making them important for ecosystem health.

plants.name: Banksia integrifolia
plants.description: An Australian native tree known for its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes composed of hundreds of tiny individual flowers. It blooms mainly in late autumn to early summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Autumn to early summer (March to June)
plants.funFact: Banksia flowers provide an important nectar source for Australian birds and mammals during blooming season.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: This aquatic plant produces large, fragrant, cup-shaped flowers that rise above the water surface. It typically blooms in warm summer months.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to summer (May to August)
plants.location: Asia, cultivated in ponds and water gardens in tropical and subtropical regions
plants.funFact: The lotus flower is a symbol of purity and spiritual enlightenment in many Asian cultures.
